intro: Thliphthisa saxicola, commonly known as the rock thliphthisa, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows on rocky outcrops and gravelly soils. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellow, and they bloom in clusters during the cooler months. Thliphthisa saxicola is valued for its resilience and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
